answerText: pseudo-random numbers[10] Evaluating a function at many randomly chosen inputs and then dividing the sum by the number of points provides an integral using this method, which was first proposed by Stanislaw Ulam and Nicholas Metropolis.
heading: NASAT |2013 | 16 | 21 | Science | Math | College
subject: Science
question: Question: These numbers can be generated via the Mersenne twister or Blum Blum Shub methods. For 10 points each: [10] Name these numbers whose sequence has no identifiable patterns.
